poem:
"Upon News of an Unquiet Autumn"

When years past eighty,
Shadowed walls whisper
of Jim Moore's unquiet deeds—
In County Down court, his winter looms.

Aust, once the school's sunflower,
felled in Hawthorne Court.
Grandmother. Teacher. 
Her name pulsed in homes, silent now.

Crimson fall, hushed by the gavel,
An old tree shakes,
its fruit, a weight unmeasured.
